result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. Mullins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.

[MK] cases #13CF128, #13CF184, #15CM148 called at 2:42pm
Defendant Joseph M. Mullins in court, in custody.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
[clerk's added note:  off-record the Court directed the clerk to remove Attorney Karl Huebner as the listed defense counsel in CCAP.] 
The Court has scheduled this hearing because it believes that the sentence-credit issue has been fully resolved by the recent Amended Judgments of Conviction, however the Court has noted that Mr. Mullins currently has an appeal pending. 
The Court inquiries of Mr. Mullins about his current custody status. 
Mr. Mullins verifies that he is currently on Extended Supervision, however he is in-custody now because he is serving a 10 day alternate sentence term related to non-payment of a fine.  
Mr. Mullins indicates that his appeal was filed solely in regarding to the DOC's handling of his prison account-funds.  Now that he is on E.S., he is withdrawing the Appeal.  He filed a form for this before his left the Prison, and he believes the withdrawl is still being processed. 

Mr. Mullins indicates that, upon release, his address will be:  c/o Eileen Gess, 306 Rogers Street, Fort Atkinson 
recess 2:47pm

Cases 15CM148 & 15CM370 called together at 1:43 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Joseph M. Mullins in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CM148: Atty Huebner submits plea paperwork:
Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 15 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence forthwith
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $443 (includes DNA) + $33 summons fees = $476; due in $50 increments per month beginning 1/15/16 and on the 15th day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

15CM370: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial DEMANDED by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession of drugs or paraphernalia
-Take all prescription medications as prescribed
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No contact with Annette Krueger   
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 1:59

[Reserve Judge Sarah OBrien presiding for Branch IV]
Case called at 9:50am [mo]
Defendant Joseph M. Mullins appears via video conferencing from the Jefferson County jail, in custody. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

Right to Counsel given; Mr Mullins indicates that he would like counsel
Mr. Mullins wishes to postpone the hearing until he has counsel
The Court inquires of Mr. Mullins his address upon release from jail, Mr. Mullins indicates that he is unsure of his address upon release
Mr. Mullins indicates that John Osheski is his probation officer (to obtain contact with Mr. Mullins in case of non-residence upon release)
The Court does not set bond at this time.
